p: District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holden at Tacoma (to wit: Tacoma) in and for the County of Pierce
John Lanmeister and John Tod Plaintiffs vs. Or. C. Shattuch Defendant}
Know All Men By This Presents:
That we John Lanmesiter and John Tod of the City of Tacoma County of Pierce and Territory of Washington as principals, and William Bradley and O.J. Anderson of the same place as sureties.

are held and firmly bound unto W. C. Shattuch of said county of Pierce in the sum of Three Hundred Dollars, for which payment will and truly be made; are jointly and sernally find ourselves, one and each of one heirs, executors and administrators by these presents.
Stated with our seals. Dated the eleventh day of December, 1884.

The condition of the above obligation is such. That whereas the above named plaintiffs John Lanmeister and John Tod have commenced an action in the above entitled Court against W. C. Shattuch the defendant herein for the recovery of two hundred and fourteen dollars and seventy one cents ($214.71) with interest thereon from the sixth day of December, 1884, alleged to be due from said defendant to said plaintiffs for goods, wares and merchandise sold and delivered by the plaintiffs to the defendant, and said plaintiffs have filed a complaint and caused a summons to be issued in said action, and filed affidavit, and made are about to make application to the the Clerk of said Court for a writ of attachment against the property of said defendant as security for the satisfaction of any judgment that the plaintiffs may
1277
recover therein: How, if the said plaintiffs shall pay, all costs that may be adjudged to the defendant and all damages that he may sustain by reason of the attachment, should the same be wrongfully, oppressively or maliciously sued out not exceeding the sum specified in this bond as the penalty thereof. then this obligation shall be void, otherwise shall remain in full force and effect.
Signed, sealed and delivered in presence of Jas T. Lewis
